poem:
Healing the Invisible

Daily fear,  
a whispering ghost,  
lingers at tables,  
uninvited.

Yet,  
in white coats,  
hope steadies nerves,  
trial by trial,  
nudging allergies  
into retreat—

small shifts  
in science's hand  
sow a garden  
of options  
for trembling hearts  
hungering  
to breathe free.
